boat.name: Simo
boat.full_description: Fully equipped for short and single handed sailing with a Hasler SP 2 servo pendulum vane gear that steers her in foul wind and fair, she sails in any ocean and is in exceptional condition.     She is currently lying in Portugal and has spent a lot of her life in the warmer climates, the varnish work is maintained to a high standard.  Owned by Mr Oliver for well over 30 years and spent long periods on the Algarve and in the Med. The boat was claimed as a gambling debt when Mr Oliver died and was shipped to Laurent Giles in Lymington for disposal. Mr J Snell bought her and kept her at Scarborough. He had the boat for approx. 10 years and then died. Michael Chamberlain found the boat in a barn in excellent condition, purchased her and cruised to the Med and the Algarve. In 2013 Simo is returning to the UK.
boat.construction_details: Pitch pine below the water, teak above, teak decks
boat.short_description: Simo is currently for sale, lying in Portugal.
